attributes.action: That the UK makes a greater effort to eliminate Child Poverty.
attributes.additional_details: At the Synod of the Moravian Church in Great Britain and Ireland, a Resolution was passed to demand that the UK Parliament makes a greater effort to eliminate Child Poverty. Research by the Child Poverty Action Group, shows that in 2019-20 there were 4.3 million children living in poverty in the UK. The Office for National Statistics shows that poverty can have a serious impact on a child’s life chances, and from experiences gained by our churches and members serving their communities.
attributes.background: We call on our government to look afresh at how this country can support children  through the tax and benefits systems, especially in light of the recent changes to Universal Tax Credit.

rejection.details:
We currently have three petitions open on the same or similar topics that you may like to sign:

Create and implement a strategy for eradicating child poverty
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600249

Commission an independent review of childcare funding and affordability
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586700

Increase flat rate of Child Maintenance to £21.15 p/w
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598757
